physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initial symptoms included urticaria and angioedema after exposure to Muscari comosum. Skin prick tests showed positive reactions to Dermatophagoides pteronyssinus and extracts of raw and cooked Muscari comosum bulb.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms occurred on three different occasions, worsening with exposure to cooking vapors and ingestion of contaminated foods.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 3-year-old boy exhibited daily short-lived urticaria affecting the face, trunk, and extremities. A wheal response was noted upon skin compression.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Urticaria persisted over 6 months with some improvement noted following the administration of ketotifen.
